body.p: In the Board’s view, the treatment of plan administration costs should depend on the nature of those costs. Therefore, the 2010 ED proposed that:

li.p: costs of managing plan assets should be the only administration costs that are deducted in determining the return on plan assets (that is part of the remeasurements component). Other administration costs, eg the cost of administering benefit payments, are unrelated to the plan assets.

the present value of the defined benefit obligation should include the present value of costs relating to the administration of benefits attributable to current or past service. This is consistent with the measurement objective that the defined benefit obligation should be determined on the basis of the ultimate cost of the benefits.
